fling.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to throw something somewhere using a lot of force
fling.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He flung the box into the river.
People cheered and flung their hats into the air.
fling.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to throw or move something roughly and carelessly
fling.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He flung his coat over the back of a chair.
She flung back the covers and got up.
He flung the books aside angrily.
fling.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to push someone roughly, especially so that they fall to the ground
fling.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He grabbed her arm and flung her to the ground.
fling.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to move yourself or part of your body quickly, using a lot of force
fling.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: He flung himself down on the bed.
She flung her arms round Louise.
fling.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to say something to someone in an angry way
fling.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: People were flinging all sorts of accusations at her.
His own words were flung back at him.
fling.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a short and not very serious sexual relationship
fling.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: They had a brief fling a few years ago.
fling.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a short period of time during which you enjoy yourself without worrying about anything
fling.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: He sees this as his final fling before he retires.
